article:
A 'maternity den', in the animal kingdom, is a lair where the mother gives birth
and nurtures the young, when they are in a vulnerable life stage. While such
dens are typically subterranean, they may also be snow caves or simply beneath
rock ledges. Characteristically there is an entrance, and optionally an exit
corridor, in addition to a principal chamber. C. Sillero-Zubiri, 2004
categories: Shelters built or used by animals
